metadata.title: CVE-2021-41864 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
prealloc_elems_and_freelist in kernel/bpf/stackmap.c in the Linux kernelbefore 5.14.12 allows unprivileged users to trigger an eBPF multiplicationinteger overflow with a resultant out-of-bounds write.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-41864` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
